Presence.name: Manipulate Someone
Presence.description: When you Manipulate Someone, roll +Presence. On a hit, they'll do what you want if you promise them something they want.

outcomes.13+: Not only do they do what you want right now, they also become your ally for the rest of the mystery (or, if you do enough for them, permanently).
outcomes.10+: Then they’ll do it for the reason you gave them. If you asked too much, they’ll tell you the minimum it would take for them to do it (or if there’s no way they’d do it).
outcomes.7-9: They'll do it, but only if they’ll do it, but only if you do something for them right now to show that you mean it. If you asked too much, they’ll tell you what, if anything, it would take for them to do it.
outcomes.6-: They won't do it, and they're probably pissed off

Nerve.name: Act Under Pressure
Nerve.description: When you Act Under Pressure, roll +Nerve.

outcomes.13+: Choose to either do what you wanted and something extra, or to do what you wanted to absolute perfection.
outcomes.10+: You do what you set out to do
outcomes.7-9: You stumble, hesitate, or flinch: the Keeper will offer you a worse outcome, hard bargain, or ugly choice

Nerve.name: Help Out
Nerve.description: When you Help Out another hunter, roll +Nerve.

outcomes.13+: Your help lets them act as if they just rolled a 13+, regardless of what they actually got.
outcomes.10+: Their outcome goes up by one success rank (from 6- to 7-9; from 7-9 to 10+)
outcomes.7-9: Their outcome goes up by one success rank (from 6- to 7-9; from 7-9 to 10+), but you expose yourself to danger, cost, or trouble

Insight.name: Investigate a Mystery
Insight.description: When you Investigate A Mystery, roll +Insight.

outcomes.13+: You may ask the Keeper any question you want about the mystery, not just the listed ones.
outcomes.6-: Hold 1, but you reveal some information to whoever you are questioning, or learn something you wish wasn't true

arrays.title: Hold Options
values: What happened here, in the real sequence of events?
What force or influence is at work (human, occult, institutional, etc)?
What person, organization, or faction is implicated?
What can it do (capabilities, reach, constraints)?
What is the vulnerability (what disrupts, binds, exposes, or hurts it)?
Where does this lead next?
What is being concealed, and who benefits from the concealment?
What hidden history or suppressed scholarship underlies this (an old rite, a censored paper, a destroyed painting, etc)?

Insight.name: Read a Bad Situation
Insight.description: When you look around and Read A Bad Situation, roll +Insight. If you act on the answers, you get +1 ongoing while the information is relevant.

outcomes.13+: You may ask the Keeper any question you want about the situation, not just the listed ones.
outcomes.6-: The Keeper will tell you what trouble you're walking into

arrays.title: Hold Options
values: What's my best way in?
What's my best way out?
Are there any dangers we haven't noticed?
What's the biggest threat?
What's most vulnerable to me?
What's the best way to protect the victims?

Vigor.name: Necessary Violence
Vigor.description: When you get into a fight and use Necessary Violence, roll +Vigor.

outcomes.13+: Instead pick an enhanced effect: completely hold the advantage (all hunters involved get +1 forward), suffer no harm at all, your attack inflicts double the normal harm, or your attack drives the enemy away in a rout.
outcomes.10+: You and inflict harm on (and suffer harm from) your enemies, and gain one Option from the Combat Options
outcomes.7-9: 7+, you and whatever you’re fighting inflict harm on each other. The amount of harm is based on the established dangers in the game. That usually means you inflict the harm rating of your weapon and your enemy inflicts their attack’s harm rating on you.
outcomes.6-: Your opponent inflicts harm on you as established

arrays.title: Combat Options
values: You gain the advantage: take +1 forward, or give +1 forward to another hunter.
You inflict terrible harm (+1 harm).
You suffer less harm (-1 harm).
You force them where you want them.
You make them lose something important.

arrays.title: Advanced Effects
values: You completely hold the advantage. All hunters involved in the fight get +1 forward.
You suffer no harm at all.
Your attack inflicts double the normal harm.
Your attack drives the enemy away in a rout.

outcomes.13+: Both you and the character you are protecting are unharmed and out of danger. If you were protecting a bystander, they also become your ally.
outcomes.10+: You protect them okay, but you'll suffer some or all of the harm they were going to get
outcomes.7-9: You protect them, but it's going to cost you: either you take all the harm, or you take little harm but also take -1 forward, or you suffer some other cost
outcomes.6-: You don't manage to protect them

Occult.name: Use Magic
Occult.description: When you Use Magic, say what you're trying to achieve and how you do the spell, then roll +Occult.

outcomes.13+: The magic works without issues: choose your effect, and The Keeper will offer you some added benefit.
outcomes.10+: The magic works without issues: choose your effect.
outcomes.7-9: The magic works works imperfectly: choose your effect and a glitch. The Keeper will decide what effect the glitch has.
outcomes.6-: The magic goes wrong in some terrible way

arrays.title: Effects
values: Inflict harm (1-harm ignore-armour magic obvious).
Enchant a weapon. It gets +1 harm and +magic.
Do one thing that is beyond human limitations.
Bar a place or portal to a specific person or a type of creature.
Trap a specific person, minion, or spirit.
Banish a spirit or curse from the person, object, or place it inhabits.
Summon a spirit into the world.
Communicate with something that you do not share a language with.
Observe another place or time.
Heal 1-harm from an injury, or cure a disease, or neutralize a poison.

arrays.title: Glitches
values: The effect is weakened.
The effect is of short duration.
You take 1-harm ignore-armour.
The magic draws immediate, unwelcome attention.
It has a problematic side effect.

arrays.title: The Keeper may say that...
values: The spell requires weird materials.
The spell will take 10 seconds, 30 seconds, or 1 minute to cast.
The spell requires ritual chanting and gestures.
The spell requires you to draw arcane symbols.
You need one or two people to help cast the spell.
You need to refer to a tome of magic for the details.

ClockMoves.name: Luck
ClockMoves.description: Your Luck saves you from terrible consequences

advance.name: Expend Luck
advance.description: Mark Luck when your luck saves you from terrible consequences. You get a 12+ on the role. Still mark experience. Make sure you take account of your Luck Special

ClockMoves.name: Harm
ClockMoves.description: Physical damage taken by the hunter

advance.name: Take Harm
advance.description: Mark harm when you are injured

rollback.name: Heal Harm
rollback.description: First aid heals 1 harm. Proper medical attention heals 2 harm. A full recovery heals all harm.

ClockMoves.name: Experience
ClockMoves.description: Experience gained through success and failure

advance.name: Mark Experience
advance.description: Mark Experience when you are roll a 6-, or when you answer questions at the end of the session

rollback.name: Unmark Experience
rollback.description: Use this to correct accidentally marking experience
